channel.title: 经济学人
channel.description: 这是一个追踪经济学人news的种子

item.title: 纽约的房价高得惊人。事实上，它是北美最昂贵的城市。看看您的城市排名如何 👇
item.description:
New York is startlingly expensive. In fact, it is the most costly city in North America. Find out where yours ranks https://t.co/RQDXDBJHou 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 21, 2024

item.title: "这些人不在乎美国梦，他们只在乎钱。"《1843》杂志讲述了美国最致命的人口走私企图背后的故事。
item.description:
“These people don’t care about the American dream, they just care about money.”

1843 magazine tells the story behind one of the country’s deadliest people-smuggling attempts https://t.co/VoQNUqWFW4

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 21, 2024

item.title: 詹姆斯-布拉德利（James Bradley）是在公路上长大的，当时美国卡车司机的形象还沉浸在边疆的神话中。这是一个蓝领卡车司机如何卷入美国最致命的人口走私企图的故事。
item.description:
James Bradley came of age on the road, when the figure of the American truck driver was steeped in the myth of the frontier.

This is the story of how a blue-collar trucker got involved in one of America’s deadliest people-smuggling attempts https://t.co/UWVxNJAfFz

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 21, 2024

item.title: 世界上最可爱的语言是什么？我们回顾语言的魅力 👇
item.description:
What is the world’s loveliest language? We review the attractiveness of speech https://t.co/8O8hdzuc6r 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 21, 2024

item.title: 雄心勃勃的女性尽可能地努力变瘦，这在经济上是合理的。这是一个悲剧👇。
item.description:
It is economically rational for ambitious women to try as hard as possible to be thin. That is a tragedy https://t.co/T1ALNTTGp4 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 21, 2024

item.title: 随着最近几周战斗的加剧，弗拉基米尔-普京（Vladimir Putin）的火炮发射的炮弹数量约为乌克兰的五倍。 👇
item.description:
Vladimir Putin’s guns are firing around five times as many shells as Ukraine’s are, as fighting has intensified in recent weeks.

Russia’s firepower gives it a clear advantage—but does it have enough artillery to keep it up? https://t.co/85WIXNMCJt 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 21, 2024

item.title: 去年，有 4.3 万名来自俄罗斯、4.2 万名来自印度和 2.4 万名来自中国的移民过境。而在 2021 年，这一数字分别为 4100 人、2600 人和 450 人👇。
item.description:
Last year 43,000 migrants from Russia, 42,000 from India and 24,000 from China made the crossing. That’s up from 4,100, 2,600 and 450, respectively, in 2021 https://t.co/nptyd2ndxY 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 20, 2024

item.title: 美国经济繁荣的背后是什么？我们的 "制衡 "播客进行了调查。敬请收听 @JohnPrideaux、@chowardchoward 和 @imkahloon 🎧 。
item.description:
What’s behind America’s buoyant economy? Our “Checks and Balance” podcast investigates. With @JohnPrideaux, @chowardchoward and @imkahloon https://t.co/aG8T6SI2Jx 🎧

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 20, 2024

item.title: 英伟达公司的黄仁勋（Jensen Huang）已成为我们这个时代的生成式人工智能表演者。有什么能阻止他吗？ 👇
item.description:
Nvidia’s Jensen Huang has become the generative-AI showman of our time. Can anything stop him? https://t.co/bAYNXsQ04i 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 20, 2024

item.title: Truth Social 可能很快就会上市，唐纳德-特朗普可能会拥有价值 41 亿美元的股份。但是，在因房地产业务欺诈被罚款近 5 亿美元之后，这笔交易能否帮助他解决当前的资金紧张问题？ 图片
item.description:
Truth Social may soon go public, and Donald Trump could own a stake worth $4.1bn. But after being fined nearly half a billion dollars for fraud at his property business, will the deal help him in his current cash crunch? https://t.co/d91onR2JiO

Photo: Getty Images pic.twitter.com/yUxIr8EToB

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 20, 2024

item.title: 乔-拜登（Joe Biden）在亚利桑那州访问期间发起了拉美裔选票竞选活动。亚利桑那州的拉美裔选民人数不断增加，这对民主党应该有所帮助。但唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的支持率正在上升。
item.description:
Joe Biden is launching a campaign for Latino votes during his trip to Arizona. The state’s growing Hispanic electorate should help Democrats. But Donald Trump is gaining ground https://t.co/HxIcrnBfrn 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 20, 2024

item.title: 唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）也加入了 "备忘录股票 "热潮。他的 SPAC 的投资者可能会被烧掉，但他们似乎并不介意 👇。
item.description:
Donald Trump is joining the meme-stock frenzy. Investors in his SPAC may get burned, but they don’t seem to mind https://t.co/h5xROESbSP 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 20, 2024

item.title: 一张图表不时在网络上传播，该图表显示，在过去的 35 年里，美国几乎所有的新工作岗位都是在民主党总统的领导下创造出来的。从狭义上讲，该图表是准确的，但仔细观察就会发现不同的情况👇。
item.description:
From time to time a chart showing that virtually every new job in America over the past 35 years was created under a Democratic president goes viral. Defined narrowly the chart is accurate.

But a closer look paints a different picture https://t.co/X21khP7T6r 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 20, 2024

item.title: 令人惊讶的是，美国堕胎总数增长的很大一部分是支持性州居民堕胎数量增加的结果。这种增长至少在某种程度上可能是这些州努力改善堕胎机会的结果👇。
item.description:
A surprisingly large part of America’s total growth in abortions is the result of increases among residents of supportive states.

This growth is likely to be, at least to some extent, the result of efforts to improve access in such states https://t.co/Kq20W6Dm5L 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 20, 2024

item.title: 政府影响了大量的文学作品。其中有些还很不错。以下是六本你不知道的宣传书籍👇。
item.description:
Governments influence a surprising amount of literature. Some of it pretty good. Here are six books you didn’t know were propaganda https://t.co/ZhVO2e2Q6T 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 20, 2024

item.title: 社交媒体正在经历一场深刻却鲜为人知的变革。令人震惊的是，社交媒体不再具有社交属性。潮流正在转向 👇
item.description:
Social media are undergoing a profound but little-noticed transformation. Strikingly, they are no longer very social. The tide is turning https://t.co/fke23q6sPi 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 20, 2024

item.title: 对大多数人来说，耳鸣只是暂时的烦恼。"情报》从一个人的口中得知，耳鸣对他来说是无期徒刑
item.description:
For most people, the ear-ringing of tinnitus is a temporary annoyance. “The Intelligence” hears from someone for whom it is a life sentence https://t.co/AqlOY8pJEt pic.twitter.com/ONvn8Y1hvQ

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 20, 2024

item.title: 有些徒步旅行者认为最后一英里是最难的。另一些人则发誓说这是最容易的。对美联储来说，要使通胀率回到 2% 的目标，最后一英里的跋涉既是艰辛的，也是容易的。
item.description:
Some hikers believe that the last mile is the hardest. Others swear that it is the easiest. For the Federal Reserve, the last mile of its trek to bring inflation back to its 2% target has been both https://t.co/9vFngbpLs1 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 20, 2024

item.title: 詹姆斯-布拉德利（James Bradley）只想成为一名在公路上驰骋的卡车司机。那么，他是如何成为造成 10 人死亡的同谋，并因此被判终身监禁的呢？
item.description:
All James Bradley wanted to be was a trucker on the open road. So how did he become complicit in the deaths of 10 people—earning himself a life prison sentence?@emilycgogolak investigates for 1843 magazine https://t.co/FVxXRuocW7

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 20, 2024

item.title: 在足球比赛中，同样的情况很少会遇到两次。但角球是可以重复的，是数小时专业训练的重点。这就是人工智能可以取得好成绩的地方： ⚽
item.description:
During a football match it is rare to encounter the same situation twice. But corner kicks, which are repeatable, are the focus of hours of specialist training. And doing well in them pays off.

This is where AI could score well: https://t.co/nJwkp4H7Dt ⚽

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 20, 2024

item.title: 2021 年 7 月，弗拉基米尔-普京（Vladimir Putin）发表了一篇文章，在 1000 年的历史中狂奔，声称俄罗斯人和乌克兰人是一个民族。这七张地图展示了他对过去的歪曲👇。
item.description:
In July 2021 Vladimir Putin published an essay that raced through 1,000 years of history to argue that Russians and Ukrainians are one people. These seven maps demonstrate his distortion of the past https://t.co/7XAnkbDXnS 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 20, 2024

item.title: 纽约地铁的乘客们已经见怪不怪了。@Rosemarie_Ward 告诉 "The Intelligence "为什么他们现在看到地铁站里站满了国民警卫队士兵
item.description:
Riders of New York City’s subway have seen it all. @Rosemarie_Ward tells “The Intelligence” why they are now seeing stations lined with National Guard troops https://t.co/8ljdqbjSYD pic.twitter.com/AOPMD5QsO7

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 20, 2024

item.title: 弗拉基米尔-普京入侵乌克兰正在改变远东城市符拉迪沃斯托克。通过我们的互动报道，探索这个战时俄罗斯的缩影👇。
item.description:
Vladimir Putin’s invasion of Ukraine is transforming the far eastern city of Vladivostok. Explore this microcosm of wartime Russia with our interactive report https://t.co/bZy4euSOyT 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 20, 2024

item.title: 两千多年后，纽约市外的极端东正教犹太妇女也在进行类似的罢工--原因另当别论 👇。
item.description:
In the play “Lysistrata”, the women of warring Greek states deny their lovers sex in protest against an ongoing war.

More than two millennia later ultra-­Orthodox Jewish women outside New York City are carrying out a similar strike—for another reason https://t.co/nzrRFyPtE2 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 20, 2024

item.title: 投资者为何将资金投入基础设施资产？本周的 "Money Talks "播客将为您揭晓答案： 🎧
item.description:
Why are investors pouring money into infrastructure assets? Find out on this week’s “Money Talks” podcast: https://t.co/J8dMQ2fPlT 🎧

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 20, 2024

item.title: 在肯尼亚的一个角落，几乎每个人都参加了随机对照试验。有传言说，实验派发的现金会受到诅咒👇。
item.description:
In one corner of Kenya, virtually everyone has taken part in a randomised controlled trial. Rumours have spread that cash handouts from experiments are cursed https://t.co/7DFpDsKkSs 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 20, 2024

item.title: 习近平认为，中国比美国等国家更民主。在我们的 "鼓楼 "播客中，@aliceysu 和 @jarmiles 对这一说法背后的意识形态体操进行了解读，并问道：中国公众相信吗？ 🎧
item.description:
Xi Jinping argues that China is more democratic than countries like America. On our “Drum Tower” podcast, @aliceysu and @jarmiles get their heads around the ideological gymnastics behind that claim, and ask: does the Chinese public believe it? https://t.co/IOA1nnU7PF 🎧

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 20, 2024

item.title: 美国的精英大学臃肿、自满、不自由。为了保持竞争优势，常春藤联盟必须改变⬇️。
item.description:
America’s elite universities are bloated, complacent and illiberal.

To keep its competitive edge the Ivy League will have to change ⬇️

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 20, 2024

item.title: 克里斯蒂娜-布拉西-福特（Christine Blasey Ford）重新成为聚光灯下的焦点。阅读大法官布雷特-卡瓦诺的指控者如何通过回忆录回归 👇
item.description:
Christine Blasey Ford is re-entering the spotlight. Read how Justice Brett Kavanaugh’s accuser has returned with a memoir https://t.co/Xf2JDa1p10 👇

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 20, 2024

item.title: "从长远来看，这只会真正损害香港"。在 "情报 "节目中@billridgers 探讨了一项新的国家安全法，这一次，它不会再遭到抗议。收听播客： 🎧
item.description:
“In the long run this can only really harm Hong Kong.” On “The Intelligence” @billridgers examines a new national-security law that, this time, will not be met with protests. Listen to the podcast: https://t.co/4GJRFs5ngh 🎧

— The Economist (@TheEconomist) March 20, 2024
